body_html:
@vrv Thanks for the review. If we use name=None at the end then it will thrown out a syntax error:

  File "/home/ubuntu/.cache/bazel/_bazel_ubuntu/ad1e09741bb4109fbc70ef8216b59ee2/execroot/tensorflow/bazel-out/local-opt/bin/tensorflow/python/special_math_ops_test.runfiles/org_tensorflow/tensorflow/python/ops/special_math_ops.py", line 85
    def einsum(equation, *inputs, name=None):
                                     ^
SyntaxError: invalid syntax

So I used **kwargs to get around it.
body:
@vrv Thanks for the review. If we use `name=None` at the end then it will thrown out a syntax error:
```
  File "/home/ubuntu/.cache/bazel/_bazel_ubuntu/ad1e09741bb4109fbc70ef8216b59ee2/execroot/tensorflow/bazel-out/local-opt/bin/tensorflow/python/special_math_ops_test.runfiles/org_tensorflow/tensorflow/python/ops/special_math_ops.py", line 85
    def einsum(equation, *inputs, name=None):
                                     ^
SyntaxError: invalid syntax
```

So I used `**kwargs` to get around it.
